medium: Pen, blue and gray ink, and watercolor applied through stencil
creditline: Gift of Edward Duff Balken, Class of 1897
signed: Signed and dated in ink, lower center right under basket: J.B.B. 1831...

texts.textentryhtml: Drawn by an unknown artist, signed with the initials J. B. B., this charming still life is an example of theorem painting, a decorative art form utilizing cut and varnished paper stencils. Practiced by young women in New England and Pennsylvania, the method was a common aspect of a young lady's classroom education during the second quarter of the nineteenth century. Students were encouraged to follow closely the models provided by their teachers, but here the artist embellished her design with calligraphic pen work to represent grape vines and feathers.
